 III. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span>, in poetry <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדֵי‎</span> ( [[Num.24.20|Num 24:20]]; [[Num.24.24|Num 24:24]]; [[Ps.104.23|Ps 104:23]]; [[Ps.147.6|Ps 147:6]]; [[Job.7.4|Job 7:4]]; [[Job.20.5|Job 20:5]], and in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדֵי עַד‎</span> [[Isa.26.4|Isa 26:4]]; [[Isa.65.18|Isa 65:18]]; [[Ps.83.18|Ps 83:18]]; [[Ps.92.8|Ps 92:8]]; [[Ps.132.12|Ps 132:12]]; [[Ps.132.14|Ps 132:14]]:compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֱלֵי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲלֵי‎</span>), **preposition** ==as far as, even to, up to, until, while== (Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עד‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עדי‎</span>, [[BDB#Mordt|Mordtm]]<sup>ZMG xxx (1876), 27</sup>; [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>xxxvii (1883), 414</sup>, Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***adi***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>§ 81 a</sup> (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***except***); perh akin to <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***pass on, advance to***, [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 304, 309:</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדֵי‎</span> probably from ground-form <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***±¦d¦y***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Ol|Ol]]<sup>428, 431</sup> [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 309 ff.</sup>; but [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>Sym. ii. 101-3, Mitth. i. 231 f.</sup>, as plur. like <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחֲרֵי‎</span>); — with suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָדַי‎</span> [[Num.23.18|Num 23:18]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָדֶיךָ‎</span> [[Mic.4.8|Mic 4:8]] +, etc., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָֽדיֵכֵם‎</span> [[Job.32.12|Job 32:12]]; [[2Kgs.9.18|2Kgs 9:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדהֵֿם‎</span> occurs; — ***as far as, even*** to (differing from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> in that the limit is included, as in Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Fl|Fl]]<sup>Kl. Schr. i. 402 f.</sup>): 

**I. preposition 1.** of ***space***; — 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [[Gen.11.31|Gen 11:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ויבאו‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד חרן‎</span> ***as far as*** Haran, [[Gen.12.6|Gen 12:6]]; [[Gen.13.3|Gen 13:3]]; [[Gen.13.12|Gen 13:12]] + often, [[Isa.8.8|Isa 8:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד צואר יגעַ‎</span>, [[Isa.15.4|Isa 15:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד יהץ נשׁמע קולם‎</span>, [[Isa.25.12|Isa 25:12]]; [[Isa.26.5|Isa 26:5]]; [[Ps.36.6|Ps 36:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אמונתך עד שׁחקים‎</span>, [[Ps.69.2|Ps 69:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דאו מים עד נפשׁ‎</span> (compare [[Jonah.2.6|Jonah 2:6]]; [[Mic.1.9|Mic 1:9]]; [[Jer.4.10|Jer 4:10]]; [[Jer.4.18|Jer 4:18]]), [[Jer.90.3|Jer 90:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּשֵׁד אֱנוֺשׁ עַד דַּכָּא‎</span> [[Job.11.7|Job 11:7]], etc.; pregnantly [[Ps.118.27|Ps 118:27]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִסְדוּ חָג עַד וגו‎</span> ***bind*** . . . (and lead) ***up to . . .***; [[Isa.57.9|Isa 57:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מֵרָחוק‎</span> ***even to*** afar (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> **1 c**); ==with the goal a== ***person***, [[Exod.22.8|Exod 22:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎האלהים יָבאֹ דְבַר שְׁנֵיהֶם‎</span>, [[1Sam.9.9|1Sam 9:9]]; [[Ps.65.3|Ps 65:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָדֶיךָ כָלבָּֿשָׂר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָבאֹוּ‎</span> [[Isa.45.24|Isa 45:24]]; [[Job.4.5|Job 4:5]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּב עַד י‎</span> [[Hos.14.2|Hos 14:2]] ***al.*** (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּב‎</span>, stronger than <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּב אֶליֿ‎</span>); in poetry [[Num.24.20|Num 24:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאַחֲדִיתוֺ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדֵי אֹבֵד‎</span> shall be ***even unto*** destruction, shall issue in destruction, v[[Num.24.24|Num 24:24]] rarely with verbs of ***attending***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶאֱזִין עַד‎</span> [[Num.23.18|Num 23:18]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִתְבּוֺנֵן עַד‎</span> [[Job.32.12|Job 32:12]]; [[Job.38.18|Job 38:18]] (usually <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span>). Before another perp., [[1Sam.7.11|1Sam 7:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מִתַּחַת ל‎</span> [[1Kgs.4.12|1Kgs 4:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מֵעֵבֶר ל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מֵעַל‎</span> [[Ezek.41.20|Ezek 41:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לִפְנֵי‎</span> [[Esth.4.2|Esth 4:2]], and even (si vera. l.) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אְלֵיהֶם‎</span> [[2Kgs.9.20|2Kgs 9:20]]:compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד נֶגֶד‎</span> [[Neh.3.16|Neh 3:16]]; [[Neh.3.26|Neh 3:26]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד נֹכַח‎</span> [[Judg.19.10|Judg 19:10]] +.


$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** In the combination <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן ֗֗֗ (וְ)עַד‎</span>, as [[Gen.10.19|Gen 10:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מצידון ֗֗֗ עַד עַזָּה‎</span> ***from*** Sidon . . . ***as far as*** Gaza + often (see <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מן‎</span> **5 a**); and idiomatic, not of actual space, but of ***class of objects***, to express the idea of ***both... and***, as [[Gen.19.4|Gen 19:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִנַּעַר וְעַד זָקִן‎</span> ***from*** young ***to*** old (inclusively) = ***both*** young ***and*** old (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> **5 b**); ==without== <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>, ***even to*** = ***including***, [[Lev.11.42|Lev 11:42]]; [[Num.8.4|Num 8:4]] ***even to*** (i. e. including) it base and its flower, compare [[1Sam.18.4|1Sam 18:4]].


**2.** Of ***time:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***(a) even to, until*** [[Gen.8.5|Gen 8:5]] ***even to*** the 10th month, [[Exod.12.6|Exod 12:6]] ***unto*** the 14th day, etc., v[[Exod.12.15|Exod 12:15]] v[[Exod.12.18|Exod 12:18]], etc.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד היום‎</span> ***unto this day***, [[Gen.19.37|Gen 19:37]]; [[Gen.19.38|Gen 19:38]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד היום הזה‎</span> [[Gen.26.33|Gen 26:33]]; [[Gen.32.33|Gen 32:33]], both + often; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד יום‎</span> followed by infinitive [[Exod.40.37|Exod 40:37]]; [[Josh.6.10|Josh 6:10]]; [[Judg.18.30|Judg 18:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד בקר‎</span> ***till*** morning, [[Exod.12.10|Exod 12:10]] + (15 t.), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד הבקר‎</span> [[Exod.16.23|Exod 16:23]] + (11 t.); so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד (ה)ערב‎</span> [[Exod.18.13|Exod 18:13]]; [[Exod.18.14|Exod 18:14]] +, in poetry <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲרֵי ערב‎</span> [[Ps.104.23|Ps 104:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד עוֺלָם‎</span> [[Gen.13.15|Gen 13:15]] + often; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים‎</span> [[2Kgs.4.35|2Kgs 4:35]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד דּוֺר וָדוֺר‎</span> [[Isa.13.20|Isa 13:20]] see also  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּלִי‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בִּלְתִּי‎</span>, ***near the end*** and followed by another preposition, [[Lev.23.16|Lev 23:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מִמָּחֳרַת הַשַּׁבָּת‎</span>, [[Neh.13.9|Neh 13:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת‎</span>. With the force of ***against***, [[Judg.6.31|Judg 6:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יוּמַת עַד הַבֹּקֶר‎</span>; compare ***(b) end.*** ***(b)*** followed by infinitive, both of past time, as [[Gen.8.7|Gen 8:7]]; [[Gen.32.35|Gen 32:35]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד עֲלוֺת הַשַּׁחַר‎</span>, [[Gen.33.3|Gen 33:3]]; [[Gen.34.5|Gen 34:5]], and especially future time, as [[Gen.3.19|Gen 3:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד שׁוּבְךָ‎</span> ***until*** thy returning, [[Gen.19.22|Gen 19:22]]; [[Gen.27.45|Gen 27:45]]; [[Deut.7.20|Deut 7:20]]; [[Deut.7.23|Deut 7:23]]; [[Deut.20.20|Deut 20:20]]; [[Deut.22.2|Deut 22:2]]; [[Deut.28.20|Deut 28:20]]; [[Deut.28.22|Deut 28:22]], — both + often; compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד בּוֺשׁ‎</span> [[Judg.3.25|Judg 3:25]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד תֹּם ֗֗֗ ‎</span> [[Lev.25.29|Lev 25:29]] + 10 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד תֻּמָּם‎</span> [[Deut.2.15|Deut 2:15]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כַּלֵּה‎</span> [[2Kgs.13.17|2Kgs 13:17]]; [[2Kgs.13.19|2Kgs 13:19]]; [[Ezek.19.14|Ezek 19:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כַּלּוֺתָ(םׅ‎</span> [[1Sam.15.18|1Sam 15:18]]; [[Jer.9.15|Jer 9:15]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אוֺר הַבֹּקֶר‎</span> [[Judg.16.2|Judg 16:2]] +; also in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד הִשְׁמִדְךָ אֹתָם‎</span> [[Deut.7.24|Deut 7:24]] (compare [[Deut.28.48|Deut 28:48]]; [[Josh.11.14|Josh 11:14]]; [[1Kgs.15.29|1Kgs 15:29]]; [[2Kgs.3.25|2Kgs 3:25]]; [[2Kgs.10.17|2Kgs 10:17]]; [[2Kgs.24.20|2Kgs 24:20]] [\|\| [[Jer.52.3|Jer 52:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִשְׁלִיכוֺ‎</span>]; on the anomalous <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִ‎</span>, see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]], read probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַ‎</span>); and most probably compare [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>iii. 583</sup>) in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד בִּלְתִּי הִשְׁאִיר לוֺ (לָהֶם) שָׂרִיד‎</span> [[Deut.3.3|Deut 3:3]] (see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), + 5 t. (see above), read probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַשְׁאִיר‎</span>. With the force of ***towards the end of, against***, especially in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד בֹּאָ(םׅ‎</span>, [[Gen.43.25|Gen 43:25]]; [[Exod.22.25|Exod 22:25]]; [[Num.10.21|Num 10:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎והקימו‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎את המשׁכן עַד בֹּאָם‎</span> used to set up the tabernacle ***against*** their coming, [[2Kgs.16.11|2Kgs 16:11]]; [[Ezek.33.22|Ezek 33:22]] compare [[2Sam.17.22|2Sam 17:22]]. Elliptical [[Judg.16.2|Judg 16:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אוֺד הַבֹּקֶד וַהֲרַגְנוּהוּ‎</span> (wait) ***till*** the morning dawn, and we slay him! ([[BDB#GFM|GFM]]; [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 115</sup>). (c) with various adverbs of time. (q. v.) as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אָנָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדמָֿה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מָתַי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד הֵנָּה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כֹּה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כֵּן‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד עַתָּה‎</span>, compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כַּמֶּה פְעָמִים‎</span> (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה‎</span> **4 b**). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***d***) to suffest also ***degree*** (compare **3**), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֵין מָקוֺם‎</span> ***until*** there is no place [[Isa.5.8|Isa 5:8]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֵין מִסְפָּר‎</span> [[Ps.40.13|Ps 40:13]]; [[Job.5.9|Job 5:9]]; [[Job.9.10|Job 9:10]] compare [[Lev.26.18|Lev 26:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאִםעַֿדאֵֿלֶּה‎</span> and if ***even up to these things***, even the end of all these punishment, you do not hearken to me.


$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***During*** (rare; prop, ***as far as*** the limit indicated, including the time previous, compare <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἔως</span>: so often Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַד‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, ***while***), [[2Kgs.9.22|2Kgs 9:22]] what is peace <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד זְנוּנֵי אִיזֶבֶל‎</span> ***during***, etc.,? [[Job.20.5|Job 20:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדֵי רָ֑גַע‎</span> ***during*** a moment; followed by infinitive [[Judg.3.26|Judg 3:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד הִתְמַהְמְהָם‎</span> ***during*** their delaying, [[Exod.33.22|Exod 33:22]]; [[Job.7.19|Job 7:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד בִּלְעִי רֻקִּי‎</span> [[Jonah.4.2|Jonah 4:2]].


**3.** Of ***degree***, to suggest a higher or the highest; as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מְאֹד‎</span> ***even to*** muchness, i.e. exceedingly (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְאֹד‎</span>), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מְהֵרָה‎</span> ***even to haste*** [[Ps.147.15|Ps 147:15]]; [[Esth.5.6|Esth 5:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמַהבֻּֿקָּשָׁתֵךְ עַדחֲֿצִי הַמַּלְכוּת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְתֵעָשׂ‎</span>, v[[Esth.5.3|Esth 5:3]]; [[Esth.7.2|Esth 7:2]]. See also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְ‎</span>, below. With a negative, to express ***not even as much as***, [[Deut.2.5|Deut 2:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לא אתן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לכם מארצם עַד מִדְרַךְ כַּף רָ֑גֶל‎</span>, and with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶחָד‎</span>, [[Exod.9.7|Exod 9:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא מֵת ֗֗֗ עַדאֶֿחָד‎</span>, simil. [[Exod.14.28|Exod 14:28]]; [[Judg.4.16|Judg 4:16]]; [[2Sam.17.22|2Sam 17:22]] (read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶחָד‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׃אַחַד‎</span> see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]). Sts. almost = Latin <abbr title="transliteration"><u>adeo</u></abbr>, [[1Sam.2.5|1Sam 2:5]] (si vera lectio) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד עֲקָרָה ילדה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁבעה‎</span> ***even to*** the barren, she hath borne seven, i.e. ***even*** the barren hath, etc., [[Job.25.5|Job 25:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הן עדיָֿרֵחַ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ולא יאהיל‎</span>, [[Hag.2.19|Hag 2:19]]. In comparisons, ***to the degree of, even like*** (rare), [[Nah.1.10|Nah 1:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד סִירִים סְבֻכִים‎</span> (text dubious) entangled ***even like*** thorns, [[1Chr.4.27|1Chr 4:27]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לא הִרְבּוּ עד בני יהודה‎</span> did not multiply ***to the degree of*** (i.e.***like***), etc. compare. [[2Sam.23.19|2Sam 23:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד הַשְּׁלשָׁה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא בָא‎</span> did not ***attain*** (in prowess) ***unto*** the three.


**II. conjunction 1.** ***until***; — 

**a** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֲשֶׁר‎</span> ***until that: (a)*** with perfect, of ***past time***, [[Exod.32.20|Exod 32:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ויטחן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד אשׁר דָּק‎</span> ([[Deut.9.21|Deut 9:21]]), [[Deut.2.14|Deut 2:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד אשׁר עָבַרְנוּ‎</span>, [[Josh.3.17|Josh 3:17]]; [[Josh.8.26|Josh 8:26]]; [[Judg.4.24|Judg 4:24]]; [[1Kgs.10.7|1Kgs 10:7]] ([[2Chr.9.6|2Chr 9:6]]), [[2Kgs.17.20|2Kgs 17:20]]; [[2Kgs.17.23|2Kgs 17:23]]; [[2Kgs.21.16|2Kgs 21:16]] with suggestion of ***degree***, [[1Sam.30.4|1Sam 30:4]] (followed by<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵין‎</span>), [[1Kgs.17.17|1Kgs 17:17]] rarely of ***future*** time (the 'future perfect,' [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 17</sup>), [[2Sam.17.13|2Sam 17:13]] (of degree), [[Ezek.34.21|Ezek 34:21]] So -<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד שֶׁ‎</span> (often in Late Hebrew; see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁ‎</span>) [[Judg.5.7|Judg 5:7]]; [[Song.3.4|Song 3:4]] (twice in verse); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כִּי‎</span> [[Gen.26.13|Gen 26:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כִּיגָֿדַל מְאֹד‎</span>, [[Gen.41.49|Gen 41:49]]; [[2Sam.23.10|2Sam 23:10]]; [[2Chr.26.15|2Chr 26:15]] and (of future time) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֲשֶׁר אִם‎</span> [[Gen.28.15|Gen 28:15]]; [[Num.32.17|Num 32:17]]; [[Isa.6.11|Isa 6:11]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) with imperfect, usually of ***future*** time, [[Gen.27.44|Gen 27:44]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֲשֶׁר תָּשׁוּב חֲמַר אָחִיךָ‎</span>, [[Gen.29.8|Gen 29:8]]; [[Exod.23.30|Exod 23:30]]; [[Exod.24.14|Exod 24:14]]; [[Lev.22.4|Lev 22:4]]; [[Num.11.20|Num 11:20]]; [[Num.20.17|Num 20:17]]; [[1Sam.22.3|1Sam 22:3]]; [[Hos.5.15|Hos 5:15]] +; rarely of ***past*** time, [[Jonah.4.5|Jonah 4:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד אשׁר יראה‎</span> ***till he should*** see, [[Eccl.2.3|Eccl 2:3]]. So (of the future) -<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד שֶׁ‎</span> [[Song.2.7|Song 2:7]]; [[Song.2.17|Song 2:17]]; [[Song.3.5|Song 3:5]]; [[Song.4.6|Song 4:6]]; [[Song.8.4|Song 8:4]]; [[Ps.123.2|Ps 123:2]] and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כִּי‎</span> [[Gen.49.10|Gen 49:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כִּייָֿבאֹ שִׁילֹה‎</span>.


$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span> alone, ***until:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) with perfect, of ***past*** time, [[Josh.2.22|Josh 2:22]]; [[Josh.4.23|Josh 4:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדעָֿבַרְנוּ‎</span>, [[1Sam.20.41|1Sam 20:41]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד דָּוִד הִגְדִּיל‎</span>, [[2Sam.21.10|2Sam 21:10]]; [[1Kgs.11.16|1Kgs 11:16]]; [[Ezek.28.15|Ezek 28:15]] of the ***future*** (rare), [[2Kgs.7.3|2Kgs 7:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מָ֑תְנוּ‎</span>, [[Ezek.39.15|Ezek 39:15]]; [[Dan.11.36|Dan 11:36]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כָּלָה זָ֑עַם‎</span>. So <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד סִם‎</span> (of the future), [[Gen.24.19|Gen 24:19]]; [[Gen.24.33|Gen 24:33]]; [[Isa.30.17|Isa 30:17]]; [[Ruth.2.21|Ruth 2:21]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) with imperfect, of ***future*** time, [[1Sam.1.22|1Sam 1:22]] (elliptic: compare [[Judg.16.2|Judg 16:2]], **12 a** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) ***end***), [[Isa.22.14|Isa 22:14]]; [[Isa.26.20|Isa 26:20]]; [[Isa.32.15|Isa 32:15]]; [[Isa.62.1|Isa 62:1]]; [[Isa.62.7|Isa 62:7]]; [[Ps.57.2|Ps 57:2]]; [[Ps.71.18|Ps 71:18]]; [[Job.27.5|Job 27:5]] +; of the ***past*** (rare), [[Exod.15.16|Exod 15:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד יעבור עמך‎</span>, v[[Exod.15.16|Exod 15:16]]; [[Josh.10.13|Josh 10:13]] (poetry) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד יִקֹּם גּוֺי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺיְבָיו‎</span>, [[Ps.73.17|Ps 73:17]]. — ****N.B.**** In poetry, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span> is sometimes used to mark not an absolute close, but an epoch or turning-point, in the future, as [[Ps.110.1|Ps 110:1]] (see [[BDB#De|De]]) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אָשִׁית אֹיְבֶיךָ הֲדֹם לְרַגְלֶיךָ‎</span>, [[Hos.10.12|Hos 10:12]]; [[Job.14.6|Job 14:6]] (but see **3**); ==after a negative clause==, [[Gen.49.10|Gen 49:10]]; [[Num.23.24|Num 23:24]]; [[Isa.42.4|Isa 42:4]]; [[Ps.71.18|Ps 71:18]]; [[Ps.112.8|Ps 112:8]]; [[Job.8.21|Job 8:21]] (but read probably with [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Du|Du]] ***al.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹד‎</span> he will ***yet***, etc., understanding v[[Job.8.20|Job 8:20]] as present, not future).


**2.** ***While*** (rare: compare 12 b): — 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** with perfect, [[1Sam.14.19|1Sam 14:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד דִּבֶּר שׁאול‎</span> ***while*** Saul spake. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** with imperfect, [[Ps.141.10|Ps 141:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַחד אָנֹכִי עַד אֶעֱבֹר‎</span> ***while I*** at the same time pass by. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** with participle, [[Job.1.18|Job 1:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד זֶה מְדַבֵּר‎</span> (but read probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹד‎</span>, as v[[Job.1.16|Job 1:16]] v[[Job.1.17|Job 1:17]]), [[Neh.7.3|Neh 7:3]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** -<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד שֶׁ‎</span> (without verb) [[Song.1.12|Song 1:12]]. So <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לֹא‎</span> ***while not = ere yet*** (of past time) [[Prov.8.26|Prov 8:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד לא עשׂה אדץ‎</span> (so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, often, e.g. [[Gen.24.15|Gen 24:15]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]], [[Matt.1.18|Matt 1:18]]); and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד אשׁר לא‎</span> (of the future) [[Eccl.12.1|Eccl 12:1]]; [[Eccl.12.2|Eccl 12:2]]; [[Eccl.12.6|Eccl 12:6]] (compare Talmud <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד דְּלָא‎</span>, Mishna <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁלּאֹ עַד‎</span>).


**3.** Of degree, ***to the point that, so that even*** (rare), [[Isa.47.7|Isa 47:7]] Thou saidst, I shall be for ever a lady, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לֹא שַׂמְתְּ אֵלֶּה עַל לִבֵךְ‎</span> ***to the point that*** (going so far in thy pride that) thou didst not, etc. (but [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Du|Du]] ***al.*** join <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גְּבֶרֶת עַד‎</span> I shall be for ever, a lady ***perpetually***; see I.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span>); [[Job.14.6|Job 14:6]] ([[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] [[BDB#Du|Du]]) ***to the point that*** he may enjoy, etc., [[Isa.22.14|Isa 22:14]] ([[BDB#Du|Du]]). In [[Josh.17.14|Josh 17:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד אֲשֶׁר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כֹּה ֵבּרְכַנִי י‎</span>, read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל אֲשֶׁר‎</span> ***because*** that ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]] [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]; compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]).

**III.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְ‎</span>, a strengthened form for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד‎</span>, found chiefly in Chronicles, Ezra, and occurring in most of the above senses. Thus 

**1.** of ***space:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבוֺא חֲמָת עַד‎</span> [[Josh.13.5|Josh 13:5]]; [[Judg.3.3|Judg 3:3]]; [[1Chr.13.5|1Chr 13:5]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִדְבָּ֫רָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד ל‎</span> [[1Chr.5.9|1Chr 5:9]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מצרים‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד ל‎</span> [[2Chr.16.8|2Chr 16:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְמִזְרַהּ הַגָּ֑יְא‎</span> [[1Chr.4.39|1Chr 4:39]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לַמְצָד‎</span> [[1Chr.12.17|1Chr 12:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לִגְרָר‎</span> [[2Chr.14.12|2Chr 14:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לַשָּׁמַיִם‎</span> [[2Chr.28.9|2Chr 28:9]]; [[Ezra.9.6|Ezra 9:6]].


**2.** Of ***time:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד לעולם‎</span> [[1Chr.23.25|1Chr 23:25]]; [[1Chr.28.7|1Chr 28:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמֵרָחוֺק עַד‎</span> [[2Chr.26.15|2Chr 26:15]]; [[Ezra.3.13|Ezra 3:13]]; [[Ezra.9.4|Ezra 9:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד למנחת הערב‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לַדָּבָר הַזֶּה‎</span> [[Ezra.10.14|Ezra 10:14]] probably ***during*** ([[BDB#Ke|Keil]]<sup>Ges</sup> [[BDB#Be|Be]] ***with regard to***, strengthened for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span>); followed by infinitive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לַעֲלוֺת הַמִּנְחָה‎</span> [[1Kgs.18.29|1Kgs 18:29]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לִכְלוֺת‎</span> [[1Chr.28.20|1Chr 28:20]]; [[2Chr.29.28|2Chr 29:28]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְכַלֵּה‎</span> [[2Chr.24.10|2Chr 24:10]]; [[2Chr.31.1|2Chr 31:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד להשׁחית‎</span> [[2Chr.26.16|2Chr 26:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לָמוּת‎</span> [[2Chr.32.24|2Chr 32:24]] (\|\| [[2Kgs.20.1|2Kgs 20:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמוּת‎</span> alone); [[Ezra.10.14|Ezra 10:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד להשׁיב‎</span>.


**3.** Of ***degree:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְמַחֲנֶה גָדוֺל‎</span> ***even unto*** (till there was) a great camp, [[1Chr.12.23|1Chr 12:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְמַ֫עְלָה‎</span> = ***exceedingly*** [[2Chr.16.12|2Chr 16:12]]; [[2Chr.17.12|2Chr 17:12]]; [[2Chr.26.8|2Chr 26:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לִמְאֹד‎</span> [[2Chr.16.14|2Chr 16:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְשִׂמְחָה‎</span> [[2Chr.29.30|2Chr 29:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לָרֹב‎</span> [[2Chr.31.30|2Chr 31:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד לְאֵין‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרְפֵּא‎</span> [[2Chr.36.16|2Chr 36:16]].

| Proverbs | [[Prov.8.26\|8:26]] |
